title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to redesignate provisions and adjust the rate of payment for benefits. Amendments are made to section 107 of title 38, United States Code, regarding payments and effective dates for benefits. Amendments to section 107 of title 38, United States Code, regarding the rate of payment for Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans. The effective date of the amendment is upon enactment and applies to benefits paid from that date onwards. Eligibility of certain Filipino veterans for disability pension. Eligibility for disability pension under title 38, United States Code, is further amended to include chapters 11, 13 (except section 1312(a)), and 15. Eligibility for disability pension under title 38, United States Code, is amended to include chapters 11, 13 (except section 1312(a)), and 15. The rate of payment is further amended by adding a new subsection for benefits under chapter 15 paid to individuals residing in the United States. The amendments made by this section expand eligibility for disability pension under title 38, United States Code, and include specific provisions for individuals residing in the Republic of the Philippines. Benefits will be paid at a rate of $100 per month to eligible individuals in the Philippines. The effective date of these amendments is the date of enactment of the Act, and they apply to benefits starting from that date. SEC. 5 amends section 1734 of title 38, providing health care for Filipino veterans in the US. SEC. 6 addresses outpatient health care for veterans in the Philippines. Section 1735 of title 38, United States Code, provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans residing in the Philippines, including treatment for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities. The Manila VA Outpatient Clinic provides outpatient care for World War II veterans in the Philippines, with a limit of $500,000 in annual expenditures. The Secretary's authority to provide care is subject to available appropriations. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act, focusing on outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines.
